H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H6918.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H6437.def: = action by which humans or animals turn their body to face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H3708.def: = state in which human experience displeasure, which is said to reside in their {L:heart<SDBH:לֵב>} ◄ and is caused by their own condition or by someone else

H2026.def: = causative action by which someone takes the life of a person, animal, or plant in a violent way

H191.def: = pertaining to being foolish, which manifests itself in a lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, much talking, and being unable to conceal one's emotions

H7068.def: = process by which humans or deities experience a sentiment of anger  for the sake of someone else, ◄ because that other person does not receive the attention, commitment, or treatment that they are entitled to

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H191.def: = pertaining to being foolish, which manifests itself in a lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, much talking, and being unable to conceal one's emotions

H6895.def: = causative action by which humans or deities consign humans to death, usually by invoking the name of a deity if the agent is human; ◄ this is done as punishment, out of contempt, fear, anger, or hostility, or because one was paid to do so; ► the effectiveness of a curse partially depends on the authority of the one pronouncing it

H7368.def: = state in which humans or objects are located in a place that is at a relatively great distance from the point of reference

H3468.def: = a state in which a human or deity helps a human in need to be safe / a safe state

H1792.def: = causative action by which an object is deformed or pulverized by exerting heavy pressure on it

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H5337.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from a situation where it could be damaged

H7457.def: = condition of not having food to eat, often leading to weakness

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H6791.def: = small, sharp-pointed projections on the stem of a plant; ≈ associated with hardship

H6782.def: = state in which humans are sensing thirst, ◄ due to lack of water; ≈ used in a figurative sense to denote longing or desire

H7602.def: = process by which humans or animals strain for breath with an open mouth, ◄ caused by exhaustion or pain

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H6083.def: = the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

H6779.def: = process by which plants, trees, or hairs come up and start growing; ≈ sometimes extended to denote the coming in existence of people, conditions, or activities

H127.def: = the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H7565.def: = a sudden burst of brighly glowing light, whose source can be seen (like fire) or invisible (like lightning)

H5774.def: = process by which an object moves through the air

H1361.def: = state in which a person or object is of great or more than average height; ≈ associated with status

H199.def: = marker indicating that the information that follows is in contrast with what has preceded

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H1875.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H1700.def: = an action or suit at law, as well as the evidence offered to support its claims

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

18.gl: to place (responsibility on someone) > to lay upon

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H2714.def: = action by which someone makes an effort to obtain information about events

H6381.def: = state in which an event is out of the ordinary, inspiring amazement, and usually associated with the supernatural

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H4557.def: = an oral or written account of something

H4306.def: = water coming down from the sky, which is indispensable for sustaining human life, but can be both refreshing and destructive

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H2351.def: = referent to the location outside of an object

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H4791.def: = a position of a relatively high elevation above the earth

H6937.def: = process by which an object becomes dark in color

H3468.def: = a state in which a human or deity helps a human in need to be safe / a safe state

H4284.def: = procedure for achieving a certain purpose, originating from someone's לֵב mind

H6175.def: = state in which someone is be able to manipulate difficult circumstances in such a way that the outcome is favorable to the planner; ≈ sometimes used in a positive sense, but also used in a negative sense

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H3920.def: = action by which humans or animals take control of (other) humans, animals, towns or land, usually with violence

H2450.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H6191.def: = to take on the shape of a heap or pile

H4116.def: = action by which humans or deities act without delay

H6617.def: literally: to wrestle; hence: = action by which humans are in a fierce competition with other humans and make a huge effort to prevail over the other

H6298.def: = process by which humans, animals, or deities come upon other humans or animals while travelling from one location to another, either or not expectedly; these encounters may be peaceful or result in aggression depending on the nature or intentions of one or both parties

H2822.def: = state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion

H4959.def: = action by which humans examine a place or object by touching ◄ usually as a result of being unable to see

H3915.def: = the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

H3467.def: = action by which humans or deities help themselves in a (difficult) situation

H34.def: = person who does not have the means to provide for himself/herself, economically or otherwise, and therefore depends on help from other people and God

H2719.def: = sharp object; ◄ made out of iron or flint; ► used as tool for various purposes

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H2389.def: = state in which humans or deities are strong in a physical, political, or military sense

H1800.def: = a hinged barrier at the entrance to a building or room; ≈ used metaphorically to denote a person's lips with special focus on the lip's ability to shut the mouth

H7092.def: literally: to close part of one's body; hence: = to stop engaging part of one's body ► in order to stop performing a certain action

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3198.def: = action by which someone with judicial authority settles a dispute between two parties

H3988.def: = state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events

H4148.def: = causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior

H7706.def: = deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All-sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God

H3510.def: = state in which humans are physically wounded

H2280.def: = state in which something has been wrapped around part of someone's body

H4272.def: = action by which humans strike other humans or animals with a hammer, club or similar object, resulting in breaking the underlying bones

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H7495.def: = causative action by which humans or deities help or cause (other) humans or animals to be restored to health or physical strength after a disease or an accident; this could also refer to the wound or disease itself; ≈ often used figuratively to denote the state of a country or nation suffering from the consequences of their unfaithfulness

H5337.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from a situation where it could be damaged

H8337.def: = state in which a countable entity is six in number

H6869.def: = a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape

H5060.def: = process or action by which the hand or another part of the body of humans gets in brief contact with an object, whether deliberately or not

H7651.def: = state in which a countable entity is seven in number

H7458.def: = state of having a lack of food for a period of time, affecting an individual for a short time or a large number of people in a geographical area for a prolonged time (as in famine)

H6299.def: = causative action by which humans exchange animals or other humans by substituting them with money or with an(other) animal, ► as a result of which they will escape death or slavery

H4194.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living

H4421.def: = armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H2719.def: = sharp object; ◄ made out of iron or flint; ► used as tool for various purposes

H2244.def: = process by which liquids become solid, ◄ caused by low temperatures during cold weather

H7752.def: = strip of leather or length of cord fastened to a handle, ► used for beating a person or urging on an animal

H3956.def: = the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

H3372.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H7701.def: = action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process

H7832.def: = action by which humans give expression to a friendly attitude, joy and amusement with the gestures and sounds that normally accompany it; ≈ this is normally regarded as a good thing, especially when done with restraint, whereas a lack of restraint is often associated with foolishness

H7701.def: = action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process

H3720.def: = condition of not having food to eat

H3372.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H1285.def: = a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses

H68.def: = hard, heavy, and strong substance, ◄ very commonly found in nature,  ► which can be hewn into different shapes by a craftsman

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H168.def: = construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary

H6485.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe a person, group, or object ► with the purpose of determining their well-being, condition, and/or integrity

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H2233.def: = a flowering plant’s unit of reproduction, capable of developing into another such plant, in some cases also used as food

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H6631.def: = object which derives from or comes from another object, used for plants and, by extension, for humans

H6212.def: = any of various plants, herbs, grasses, seed-bearing vegetation that can be consumed by human and/or animal

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H6913.def: = place where one or more people are buried, such as a hole in a rock or in the ground, or a place which was constructed specifically for this purpose; ≈ associated with death, stench and decay, uncleanness

H3624.def: = state in which humans are healthy and strong

H1430.def: = a pile of bundles of harvested ears of grain

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H2713.def: = action by which someone tries to obtain information about a certain object, person, or event by examining it carefully

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
